verbs.description: unroll (third-person singular simple present unrolls, present participle unrolling, simple past and past participle unrolled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To straighten something that has been rolled, twisted or curled.
examples: Unroll your sleeping bag and spread it on the floor of the tent.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To emerge, be revealed or become apparent; to unfold.
examples: We will have to see how the events unroll.

entries.meaning: (transitive, programming, software compilation) To replace (a loop in a program) with a repetitive sequence of the individual instructions that the loop would carry out, sometimes used as an optimization.
